name: Calzaiuoli Hotel

reviews.title: Wonderful Experience
reviews.text: Great location! Room was nice. Bed was exceptionally comfortable. Bathroom was fine. Yes, the shower didn't have a door, but who cares, it is not your room to keep! Breakfast was well stocked and in a pleasant room. We agree with some reveiws about the staff as not creating a welcoming atmosphere. But again, when you see where the hotel is, you won't care. Be sure to visit the Trattoria Marione Cucina Casalinga located on Via Della Spada, 27 r. The food is great and the prices were very reasonable.

reviews.title: perfect location-nice hotel-great value
reviews.text: Overall, it was a wonderful hotel. We would definetly visit again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: The location couldn't be better; it's right in the heart of the city and felt very safe. We had the deluxe rooms, and they were very nice. Beds and bathrooms were excellent. This hotel was a fantastic value considering its location and the quality of the accomodations. I had read reviews saying the service was bad, so I was a little concerned about that. Our experience was that the service was courteous and professional, but not overly friendly...very business-like. If you are looking for a place where the staff will gush and fuss over you, then this is definitely not the place for you. But if you simply want courteous, professional service, then you should have no complaints. My husband had reservations about staying in a hotel that was not part of a big American chain, but he was very pleased with this hotel, and we would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Location but not great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: We stayed here on our tour through Italy with our 2 teenagers.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Worth Every Penny!
reviews.text: First the positives about this hotel -

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though I'd been hit hard the day before with stomach flu and spent the first day in Florence exhausted in our room, we liked this place. I'll bet we'd have loved it had we been feeling better. I think breakfast was good, but had very little of it. Oddly, they ran out of fruit.
reviews.title: Great place

likes.disliked: — heated towel rack too close to toilet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Fantastic location-- as weak as I was, I could easily go to Dante's house, Uffizi. The Duomo and bell tower were out our window.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Hotel Calzaiuoli!

likes.disliked: — front desk people could be more welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I managed to shop.
reviews.title: Such a cute little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good service at the desk. Some English language TV, which in my case was important, but normally would not have been.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, but we ended up in a bad room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Not all rooms are handicapped accessible, be sure to ask.
reviews.title: Great location
Questionable practice
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spend two nights in Florence and booked our stay at the Hotel Calzaiuoli based on internet reviews. Overall, the amenity and charm of the hotel is everything that we expected. Unfortunately, on the day we checked in, we were told that the guests staying in the room we were slotted for could not check out due to illness. Therefore, we were sent to a neighboring hotel around the corner which the hotel staff stated was a 4-star. Well, a 4-star it was not, not even close. I've stayed in better 2-stars in London. When we went back to complain to the staff at Calzaiuoli, they stated that there was nothing they could do except to guarantee that we get our room the following day. Fortunately, they lived up their words. In fact, they upgraded us to make up for the inconvenience.

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
reviews.text: I believe I've read from other reviewers that they've shown up at the Hotel Calzaiuoli and were sent to a different hotel due to various "mix-up". I'm not sure how frequently this happens. Hopefully it's not a common practice for them, particular of using a markedly inferior hotel. However, if this does not happen to you, you'll be pleasantly surprised with you stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005
reviews.text: We just returned from our trip to Italy and stayed at the Hotel Calzaiuoli while in Florence. We had a great room on the 4th floor with a wonderful view. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was very nice. The hotel is in a great location, close to everything! We had a such a nice time and we would return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Hotel Calzaiuoli is the best!!!
Fantastic location & fantastic breakfast!
reviews.text: We just returned from our trip to Italy and Florence is definitely our favorite city. We stayed at the Hotel Calzaiuoli and it is a very elegant, clean and centrally located hotel. Our room was #319, it was a corner room with windows facing Via del Calzaiuoli and Via del Corso, there was a street performer that started his act at 9:45pm and lasted about an hour and we got to watch him perfrom from our window, it can get noisy at night as we're at a thoroughfare but it's part of the charm of our room and you can always close your windows for some peace and quiet. The breakfast buffet had a variety of choices, our room was very well maintained and everything was walking distance from our hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005
reviews.text: I made our reservations though the hotel's website and everything went as smoothly as I hoped for. We will definitely stay in this hotel again!
reviews.title: Great Florence Hotel
Fantastic Location - poor front desk service
reviews.text: Stayed in Room 414 which had a view of the dome at the Duomo. This is a fantastic location - one of Florence's liveliest, most chic streets; very convenient to David, Bagello and Uffizi with a decent number of local flavor restaurants nearby. Especially good-sized rooms by European standards. Ensure you get confirmation in writing for the type of room you are reserving and the type of bed (eg. 1 bed, 2 adults) and hold the hotel to what was agreed upon.

reviews.title: loved the calzaiouli
reviews.text: Breakfast had custom-made coffee service, good croissants, but pedestrian breakfast otherwise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: My one big gripe with the hotel was the front-desk service. Diffident at best and ridiculously unhelpful at worst. If location is king for you, it probably makes up for the very poor service at Calzaiuoli.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005
reviews.text: We have just returned from a wonderful 10 day trip to Italy and we stayed in Florence at the Calzaiouli. I have to point out that I have never stayed in a hotel in Florence with such great location.
reviews.title: Smack in the Middle of the Major Sights
Ripped off at Hotel Calzaiuoli
reviews.text: Situated between Piazza del Duomo and the Piazza Di La Signoria. It just doesnt get any better. The service and cleanliness were impecable. And in addition to that it is a great deal for the money. We paid E 99.00. including an excellent breakfast. This is by far the best 3 stars I have ever experienced in Europe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005
reviews.text: This hotel is in a FANTASTIC location, in the heart of the action in Florence. The room was huge by comparison with others we stayed in in Italy, spotlessly clean and with a great view. We were at the back of the building, so got no noise either.
reviews.title: Superb location
Wonderful stay, though a bit of a splurge for us it was definitely worth it!
reviews.text: The staff were pleasant enough (by Italian standards!) - would definitely recommend if you are looking for value for money (especially if you're staying for more than 3 nights, as they do different discount packages - we got 20 euro per night off) and for being right in the middle of all the major sights and sounds of Florence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005
reviews.text: I studied in Florence as a college student and this was my second trip back since - I was bringing my parents for their first trip to Italy and this ended up being a wonderful hotel! I would love to go back again and would recommend it to anyone. Though it was the most expensive on our trip - it was a treat and well worth it. Perfect location in the heart of downtown Florence, I asked for a view of the Duomo, which we got - you do here the bells rining in the morning, but I liked it.
reviews.title: Horrid service.
Perfect hotel (if you don't need the elevator )
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helped us with reservations, brought our luggage to our room and had a wonderful breakfast with cereal, scrambled eggs (though a little runny for my taste), croissants, hams and cheeses, juices, water and of course cappucinni!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2005
reviews.text: I would definitely go back again.
reviews.title: Marvelous Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel in January 2007 for 3 nights and we could not have asked for more. The room was lovely and clean with a beautiful bathroom. The staff were very polite and helpful and told us of the best restaurant that was a hidden gem just two streets down - and I cannot remember the name now! Our bedroom overlooked the main street and there was no noise while the windows were closed and once you opened them it was magnificent to have the sounds of the street come through. I would highly recommend this hotel
reviews.title: Great hotel in the best location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel. The good points: Our room was quite large with a queen sized bed, dual desk, two chairs with a small table and a smallish flat screened tv. The windows do really keep out most of the lively Florence night noise. The breakfast is quite good and the location is fantastic. Everything is an easy walk. The hotel staff was very helpful and even volunteered to change our airport transfer car to a better time. The rooms are romantic and the bathrooms very comfortable by European standards. The toiletries were plentiful and above average.
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We did have a few small complaints. There were no drawers in our room not even in the closet. This was not a big deal, just a bit odd. There are several odd stairs and ramps inside the hotel which could be tricky for older travelers or people with disabilities.
reviews.title: Great Petit Hotel, Superb location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very nice hotel, in the very center of florence, the street on which it resides is the street that goes from the duomo to the ponte vecchio, right in the middle of those 2 attractions and just 1 block away form the piazza de la republicca. Great fares! Service is very nice, views are amazing.
reviews.title: Great hotel in fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing I would improve is room size though...
reviews.title: Spacious lovely room, wonderful breakfast

likes.disliked: — lack of air circulation, wi-fi was unavailable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our Christmas holiday in Florence and stayed at Calzaiuoli Hotel. We got a Christmas package deal from the hotel's website and never realized how excellent the deal was until we got to our room. The hotel is located along Via Calzaiuoli and is within easy walking distance from the Duomo and all the famous sights in Florence. Our room was huge for European standard, hot breakfast buffet was included and they even provided slippers...all these for a whopping 80 euros per night!!!! Our room was facing Via Calzaiuoli and it was fun to open the window and just watch the steady stream of people passing by.
reviews.title: Calzaiuoli Hotel for Unforgettable Experience in Florence
Highly Recommended
reviews.text: Calzaiuoli Hotel is by far one the best hotels we've stayed in Italy and I will definitely go back there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There aren't many bargains in Florence for Americans these days, but the Hotel Calzaiuoli is one. It is an ideal location within walking distance to many major attractions. The hotel itself is beautifully furnished with all the comforts you would expect from a four star hotel. The staff is polite and attentive, the rooms comfortable, and the breakfast excellent. The hotel is situated on a very busy pedestrian street which is noisy, especially on the weekends, but the rooms have good sound insulation. The lobby and public areas are almost non-existent, but the excellent location and well appointed rooms more than make up for that deficiency. But don't believe what the travel guides say. At this writing it is impossible to eat and drink well in Florence for less than $150 per day per couple.
reviews.title: Best Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is 2 blocks from the Duomo and walking distance to most Firenze attractions. Hotel staff were very helpful, booking all of our museum passes. We had a street facing room which we enjoyed b/c we heard the nightly street performers. Breakfast is exceptional. Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Good Hotel; Great Location
Great hotel in the heart of Florence
reviews.text: Located on the main street running between the Duomo and the Uffizi Gallery, and within very easy walking distance of both as well as other major attractions, Hotel Calzaiuoli couldn't be better situated for sightseeing. The staff are pleasant and helpful, the rooms relatively spacious by European standards, and the breakfast is certainly acceptable if not a great culinary experience. Request a room on the back as Via Calzaiuoli can be noisy at night. Our room, number 414, had wonderful views of the Duomo and the Bargello. Breakfast includes scrambled eggs and bacon as well as the usual cold meats, cheeses, breads, fruit, yogurt and cereal. Our only caution here is that our room had a mildly unpleasant odor in the bathroom. It didn’t really penetrate the rest of the room and we didn’t complain.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Calzaiuoli Hotel last week for three nights and the hotel exceeded all my expectations. Its rated 3 stars, but I would venture to say that it should be more. The hotel is very clean and beautifuly decorated with marbel and nice finishes everywhere. It has a very knowlegable consierge and a door man to help any traveler. They are vey nice, they helped me book a tour with a third party company, and even though i did not have cash to pay for the tour, they took the reservation and let me pay later on once i stopped by an atm once it was convinient for me.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel, Great location

likes.liked: — Great location with a classy and upscale hotel look and feel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in what I would say is the very best location in the city and one could not ask for anything else. It is very centraly located with the train station a 10 minute walk, and the other plazas are within 2-3 minutes.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only downside is that the room was small, but clean and had an updated bathroom with marbel everywhere. The room did have very high ceiling, which helped if frrl a bt larger. Also, the room had AC, which was key to help with the early summer heat, and satelite dish TV. Breakfast buffet was good (eggs, bacon, juice, breads, coffe, etc) and included in the price.
reviews.title: great location & value for money

likes.liked: — Location , great value for money , service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel the night before on the internet for ~$225/night (about the same price other hotels listed on hotels.com for the same period) and could not have asked for anything better. We would reccomend this to anyone.
reviews.title: A memorable wonderful hotel with an excellent view of the il Domo!!!

likes.liked: — Location. View from window. Staff. Room.

reviews.title: Great Central Hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I stay for three nights at the hotel Calzaiuoli and were very pleased with our stay. Our room was calm (even though located at the corner of the two busiest streets of downtown Florence). We had a view on both the Piazza della Republica and the cupola of the Duomo. The only drawback: the bathroom was a bit tiny (a shower curtain would have been helpful) and there were no shelves to organize our clothes (there was a closet were you could hang your jackets and pants thankfully).

description: Hotel Calzaiuoli is a 4 stars hotel in the historical centre of Florence, 2 minutes walk from Uffizi Gallery and from Cathedral.52 rooms, wifi connection free, continental buffett breakfast.
